choices.B: In the wizard, the Administrator must click on the desired vCenter server in the vCenter Server section
choices.D: The VMware View Connection Server service is halted and must be restarted
choices.A: The administrator does not have sufficient privileges
choices.C: The administrator must open PowerCLI, issue the cmdlet mkfs ""t ext3 /"My Folder"/"My Disks" to add additional space

questions.question_text: An administrator is creating an instant clone pool. During the Add pool wizard process, the Administrator gets to the vCenter Server page, selects Instant Clones and notices that the notices that the Next button is grayed out.

discussion.content:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/virtual-desktops/GUID-C450DD3D-AB0B-4B24-8981-ED6C4D1B9148.html :

Procedure
1.- In Horizon Console, select Inventory > Desktops.
2.- Click Add.
3.- Select Automated Desktop Pool and click Next.
4.- Select Instant Clones, select the vCenter Server instance, and click Next.
5.- Follow the prompts to create the pool.

Use the configuration information you gathered in the worksheet. You can go directly back to any wizard page by clicking the page name in the navigation pane.

choices.A: Verify that the certificate is added to the certificate authority's revocation list
choices.B: Verify that the certificate has a friendly name of view
choices.D: Verify that the SSL service is running on the View Connection Server instance
choices.C: Verify that the certificate is imported into the Personal folder in the Microsoft Windows local computer certificate store

questions.question_text:
An administrator connects to View Administrator and sees that the dashboard health indicator is red for the View Connection Server instance.
Clicking the red health indicator displays SSL Certificate: Invalid
What setting should the administrator review when troubleshooting this issue?
Which three actions does the User Environment Manager Helpdesk Support Tool allow a desktop support engineer to perform? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Correct Answer is BCE 
page 16 of below mentioned 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Dynamic-Environment-Manager/9.6/user-environment-manager96-helpdesk.pdf

page 4 for the reference:

The following actions can be taken with Helpdesk Support Tool:
 Reset a profile archive (or multiple profile archives *) for a user
 Restore a profile archive backup for a user
 “Jump to” a profile archive for a user in Windows Explorer *
 Edit a profile archive for a user *
 View FlexEngine log files for a user, and search for specific text
 See total profile archive and profile archive backup sizes for a user

choices.D: Restarting the (VMware UEM Service) FlexEngine service

comments.content: C is correct, according to the table you mentioned, scenario 15, Both computer AppStack and Writable are attached. User AppStack and UWV are not attached.

discussion.content: Sorry right answer is B according to this table: https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2151829

A: You can attach an AppStack to a user and a computer concurrently even if auto-login is not enabled in the VM. The AppStack is attached to the user when the user logs in.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-App-Volumes/2.13/com.vmware.appvolumes.admin.doc/GUID-73AB36FB-8B6F-42A0-9F4B-A277D25A1444.html

choices.B: Both user and machine AppStacks will be used
choices.C: Machine assigned AppStacks will be used
choices.A: User assigned AppStacks will be used

questions.question_text: If both user assigned and machine assigned AppStacks are assigned to the same session, which AppStacks will be used?
